title: Inability to create and select fork from unit test
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (b2baca3 2023-01-16T00:04:06.417962174Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Unable to use the createSelectFork method in foundry without causing an error. I have a unit test that when I pass i the fork URL and number in the command parameter it is able to successfully execute and fork. When I try to fork via the method, it errors out with the following.

```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value
Location: /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/revm-2.3.1/src/journaled_state.rs:548

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
[1]    81121 IOT instruction (core dumped)  forge test --match-contract gmdBfrAdapterTest
```

The following code was used

```

contract adapterTestFile is Test  {
    string ARBITRUM_RPC_URL = vm.envString("ARBITRUM");
    /* ... */

    constructor() {
        uint forkheight = 53_513_381;
        vm.createSelectFork(ARBITRUM_RPC_URL, forkheight);
         /* ... */
    }
}
```

I have other test files which do use the same structure for forking without error. It is unclear what the issue is.
Yes that panics. The URL string is being correctly identified as the env variable as well.

+1
It happens only on Arbitrum for me, works fine for Polygon/Ethereum:

```
  function setUp() public {
    vm.createSelectFork(vm.rpcUrl('arbitrum'), 60237425);
  }
```

Results in the following error:

```

[⠃] Compiling...
[⠰] Compiling 1 files with 0.8.17
[⠢] Solc 0.8.17 finished in 9.68s
Compiler run successful
2023-02-12T13:12:31.479416Z ERROR sharedbackend: Failed to send/recv `basic` err=GetAccount(0x5615deb798bb3e4dfa0139dfa1b3d433cc23b72f,
(code: -32000, message: missing trie node 5778051077608e62be8f7fface8876ccb4885960b900423fdd38ad067ba0f98d (path ) <nil>, data: None)) address=0x5615deb798bb3e4dfa0139dfa1b3d433cc23b72f
2023-02-12T13:12:31.697943Z ERROR sharedbackend: Failed to send/recv `basic` err=GetAccount(0x5615deb798bb3e4dfa0139dfa1b3d433cc23b72f,
(code: -32000, message: missing trie node 5778051077608e62be8f7fface8876ccb4885960b900423fdd38ad067ba0f98d (path ) <nil>, data: None)) address=0x5615deb798bb3e4dfa0139dfa1b3d433cc23b72f
2023-02-12T13:12:32.141693Z ERROR sharedbackend: Failed to send/recv `basic` err=GetAccount(0xa4b000000000000000000073657175656e636572,
(code: -32000, message: missing trie node 5778051077608e62be8f7fface8876ccb4885960b900423fdd38ad067ba0f98d (path ) <nil>, data: None)) address=0xa4b000000000000000000073657175656e636572
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value
Location: /Users/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/revm-2.3.1/src/evm_impl.rs:285

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
```
That's a good point. Yea i've only experienced it on Arbitrum as well, not on Mainnet/Polygon.

Hello!

Maybe its because revm latest version is 3.10 - and the error mentions
revm-2.3.1

Location: /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/revm-2.3.1/src/evm_impl.rs:285


On Wed, Apr 5, 2023 at 12:01 PM dev.d07 ***@***.***> wrote:

> Got the same error on BNB Mainnet chain. In the same time, the same test
> properly works on Ethereum and Polygon. To prevent any variations I've made
> my test in a docker. Here is my simple code of a test:
>
> // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
> pragma solidity ^0.8.13;
> import "forge-std/Test.sol";
> contract DummyTest is Test {
>     uint256 private mainnetFork;
>
>     uint256 private constant BLOCK_NUMBER = 27_050_910;
>
>     function setUp() public {
>         mainnetFork = vm.createSelectFork(
>             "https://bsc-dataseed.binance.org"
>         );
>     }
>
>     function testDummy() public {
>         assertEq(true, true);
>     }
> }
>
> Here is Dockerfile:
>
> FROM ghcr.io/foundry-rs/foundry:latest
> WORKDIR /app
> COPY foundry.toml remappings.txt ./COPY ./lib/ ./lib/COPY ./contracts/ ./contracts/COPY ./test/ ./test/
> RUN forge build --force
> ENTRYPOINT [ "forge", "test"]
>
> And here it the output of a docker container execution:
>
> 2023-04-05T13:54:40.295253Z ERROR sharedbackend: Failed to send/recv `basic` err=GetAccount(0xb218c5d6af1f979ac42bc68d98a5a0d796c6ab01,
> (code: -32002, message: the resource eth_getTransactionCount is not available., data: None)) address=0xb218c5d6af1f979ac42bc68d98a5a0d796c6ab01
> The application panicked (crashed).
> Message:  called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` valueLocation: /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/revm-2.3.1/src/evm_impl.rs:285This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry
>
> Are there any workarounds to solve this problem?
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/4236#issuecomment-1497640296>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOVAAPHKLOOML4YEYWC3QGDW7WCMZANCNFSM6AAAAAAUMSTXXA>
> .
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.Message
> ID: ***@***.***>
>

> (code: -32002, message: the resource eth_getTransactionCount is not available., data: None))

looks like you're provider does not support this call?

> > (code: -32002, message: the resource eth_getTransactionCount is not available., data: None))
> 
> looks like you're provider does not support this call?

Yes, when I change a provider (a quicknode, for example) the error disappears. Thank you!
